hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: We'll need to take up references net.medu.sa Alfred Winslow Jones is credited with launching the first hedge fund in 1949. He used leverage â borrowing â to buy more stock. And he used short-selling â borrowing shares in anticipation they would decline in value â to avoid market risk when stocks dropped. Given his âhedgedâ position, his fate was not determined by whether the market rose or fell, but by his choice of stocks.
